isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Diagnostics Manual - Performance Diagnostics - Test Procedures - 11. Air Management

svcproc.title: 11. Air Management
svcproc.para: PurposeTo check the operation of the Air Management System and the Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR) valve

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, comply with the following:

item.para: Read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.
Before running engine for diagnostic or service procedures, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death, use proper ventilation when operating an engine in a closed area, in order to remove deadly exhaust fumes. Inhalation of exhaust fumes may be fatal.

step1.para: Select D_KOER_AirManagement_V6.ssn in the Open Session File window, select Open to monitor engine operation.

note.para: When using the EST to do KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard Test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard Test does not have to be run again.

step1.para: Select Key-On Engine-Running Tests from the drop down menu.
From the KOER Diagnostics menu, select Air Management and select Run to start the test.
The ECM will start the Air Management test and direct the engine to accelerate to a predetermined rpm. The ECM will monitor the effects of the EGR valve movement using MAF.

item.para: If a problem is detected the ECM will cancel the test, set a DTC, and restore normal engine operation.

note.para: If engine load is above the engine load specification the test won't run.

step1.para: Record DTCs on Diagnostic Form. See " Appendix B: Diagnostic Trouble Codes " for a definition of the DTCs.
Correct problems causing active DTCs. Before replacing the EGR valve, check all other possible causes.
When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.

figure.caption: Air Management diagnostic readout for engine rpm, EGR position, and MAF

svcproc.para: The ECM commands the EGR valve to close and increases the engine idle speed to 900 rpm. The ECM allows the Manifold Air Flow (MAF) to stabilize. The ECM reads and matches the MAF pressure to the expected values; pressure is expected to increase to greater than 3.8 lb/min to pass. If the MAF does not meet the expected pressure, DTC 346 is set and the test is cancelled.

The ECM commands the EGR to open, and allows MAF to stabilize. The ECM reads MAF pressure and matches it to the expected pressure; pressure is expected to decrease to less than 2.97 lb/min to pass. If the MAF pressure does not match the expected pressure, DTC 346 is set and the test is cancelled.

The ECM commands the EGR valve to close, and allows MAF to stabilize. The ECM reads MAF pressure and matches it to the expected pressure; pressure is expected to increase to greater than 3.8 lb/min to pass. If the MAF pressure does not match the expected pressure, DTC 346 is set and the test is cancelled.
The ECM returns the EGR valve and engine idle speed to normal operation. If all flows matched or exceeded the expected flows, no DTC is set and the engine is returned to normal operation.
